info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 14 at 11:23AM PDT until October 16 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Elko NV
info.description:
...WINTER STORM WARNING FOR THE RUBY MOUNTAINS AND EAST HUMBOLDT RANGE...
.A storm system will impact Northern and Central Nevada this afternoon through Wednesday night, resulting in periods of heavy snow in the Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range. The majority of this snow will fall tonight.
* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 10 to 15 inches.
* WHERE...Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range in Elko County.
* WHEN...From 5 PM PDT this afternoon until 5 AM PDT Thursday morning.
* IMPACTS...Winds will gust as high as 50 mph on exposed ridgetops and near the crest. Travel will be extremely difficult or nearly impossible. Snow covered roads are expected on State Route 229 through Secret Pass, up to Lamoille Canyon, and across Harrison Pass in the southern end of the Ruby Mountains.
info.instruction: If you plan to travel, consider alternate strategies. If you must travel, remember to carry tire chains, plenty of food, a good deal of water, warm clothing, and a flashlight in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

parameter.value: A WINTER STORM WARNING IS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL 5 AM PDT THURSDAY MORNING

area.areaDesc: Ruby Mountains and East Humboldt Range
